Just be thankful you didn't grow up in Spain. You could smoke on buses and in schools! Put together with my dad smoking I honestly don't think I went a day without inhaling packets worth of cigarette fumes until I left home at 17.
I should also note that I was a moderate asthmatic growing up (hospitalised a few times with asthma attacks). I 'magically' got a lot better once I finished school, moved out and bought a car to travel in.
Not as weird as our drinking laws. Can't buy alcohol until 18 but can legally drink alcohol from age 5!!!
We don't have ID cards in the UK though.

My last flight had a 12 hour delay so we we're stuck in the airport and I'm not exaggerating when at least 10 smokers had to be detained and told to chill the fuck out by the police because they had formed a mob and were starting to get very aggresive (borderline violent) to the staff because they weren't allowed to smoke (can't smoke in airports/can't go out and come back in). If that's not the behaviour of an addict I don't know what is.
